page.title: 05ST MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: The church at Ingram is small and is opposite the information centre and is called ST MICHAEL'S.In the beginning the church was not as we see it now it was a thatched towerless building . In 1060 Ingram church was restored. The oldest stonework can be seen in the lower part of the tower.At the back of the building you can see remains of steps against the wall they were used to go up to a room above where they would be safe in times of war.In the vestry and now hidden behind the organ, there is a piscina built into the north wall. In the tower is a bell dated 1746 and carrying the initials of the then churchwardens.There is a service every Sunday except when weather makes it impossible.
